# 0G Galileo Testnet Node Installation Guide
![0G Network](https://img.shields.io/badge/0G-Galileo%20Testnet-blue) ![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/Version-v2.0.2-green) ![Go](https://img.shields.io/badge/Go-1.21.3-00ADD8?logo=go) ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow)
## üíª System Requirements ### Recommended Hardware - **CPU**: 8 Cores - **RAM**: 64GB - **Storage**: 1TB (NVME SSD) - **OS**: Ubuntu 20.04+ LTS ### Network Requirements - Stable internet connection - Public IP address - Open ports (will be configured during setup) ## üöÄ Manual Installation ### Step 1: Install Dependencies Update your system and install required packages: ```bash sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y sudo apt install curl git wget htop tmux build-essential jq make lz4 gcc unzip -y ``` ### Step 2: Install Go Install Go version 1.21.3: ```bash cd $HOME VER="1.21.3" wget "https://golang.org/dl/go$VER.linux-amd64.tar.gz" sudo rm -rf /usr/local/go sudo tar -C /usr/local -xzf "go$VER.linux-amd64.tar.gz" rm "go$VER.linux-amd64.tar.gz" [ ! -f ~/.bash_profile ] && touch ~/.bash_profile echo "export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin:~/go/bin" >> ~/.bash_profile source $HOME/.bash_profile [ ! -d ~/go/bin ] && mkdir -p ~/go/bin ``` ### Step 3: Set Environment Variables > ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: Replace `test` with your desired node name (moniker) ```bash echo "export MONIKER=\"test\"" >> $HOME/.bash_profile echo "export OG_PORT=\"47\"" >> $HOME/.bash_profile echo 'export PATH=$PATH:$HOME/galileo-used/bin' >> $HOME/.bash_profile source $HOME/.bash_profile ``` > üí° **Note**: You can change `OG_PORT` to a different value if port 47 is already in use ### Step 4: Download and Setup Binaries ```bash cd $HOME rm -rf galileo wget -O galileo.tar.gz https://github.com/0glabs/0gchain-NG/releases/download/v2.0.2/galileo-v2.0.2.tar.gz tar -xzvf galileo.tar.gz -C $HOME rm -rf $HOME/galileo.tar.gz mv galileo-v2.0.2 galileo chmod +x $HOME/galileo/bin/geth chmod +x $HOME/galileo/bin/0gchaind cp $HOME/galileo/bin/geth $HOME/go/bin/geth cp $HOME/galileo/bin/0gchaind $HOME/go/bin/0gchaind mv $HOME/galileo $HOME/galileo-used ``` ### Step 5: Create Configuration Directory ```bash mkdir -p $HOME/.0gchaind cp -r $HOME/galileo-used/0g-home $HOME/.0gchaind ``` ### Step 6: Initialize Geth ```bash geth init --datadir $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/geth-home $HOME/galileo-used/genesis.json ``` ### Step 7: Initialize 0gchaind ```bash 0gchaind init $MONIKER --home $HOME/.0gchaind/tmp mv $HOME/.0gchaind/tmp/data/priv_validator_state.json $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/data/ mv $HOME/.0gchaind/tmp/config/node_key.json $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/ mv $HOME/.0gchaind/tmp/config/priv_validator_key.json $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/ rm -rf $HOME/.0gchaind/tmp ``` ### Step 8: Configure Node Settings Set moniker in config: ```bash sed -i -e "s/^moniker *=.*/moniker = \"$MONIKER\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/config.toml ``` Configure custom ports for Geth: ```bash sed -i "s/HTTPPort = .*/HTTPPort = ${OG_PORT}545/" $HOME/galileo-used/geth-config.toml sed -i "s/WSPort = .*/WSPort = ${OG_PORT}546/" $HOME/galileo-used/geth-config.toml sed -i "s/AuthPort = .*/AuthPort = ${OG_PORT}551/" $HOME/galileo-used/geth-config.toml sed -i "s/ListenAddr = .*/ListenAddr = \":${OG_PORT}303\"/" $HOME/galileo-used/geth-config.toml sed -i "s/^# *Port = .*/# Port = ${OG_PORT}901/" $HOME/galileo-used/geth-config.toml sed -i "s/^# *InfluxDBEndpoint = .*/# InfluxDBEndpoint = \"http:\/\/localhost:${OG_PORT}086\"/" $HOME/galileo-used/geth-config.toml ``` ### Step 9: Set Seeds and Peers ```bash PEERS=3a11d0b48d7c477d133f959efb33d47d81aeae6d@og-testnet-peer.itrocket.net:47656 SEEDS=cfa49d6db0c9065e974bfdbc9e0f55712ee2b0b9@og-testnet-seed.itrocket.net:47656 sed -i -e "/^\[p2p\]/,/^\[/{s/^[[:space:]]*persistent_peers *=.*/persistent_peers = \"$PEERS\"/}" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/config.toml sed -i -e "/^\[p2p\]/,/^\[/{s/^[[:space:]]*seeds *=.*/seeds = \"$SEEDS\"/}" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/config.toml ``` ### Step 10: Configure Custom Ports ```bash sed -i.bak -e "s%:26658%:${OG_PORT}658%g; s%:26657%:${OG_PORT}657%g; s%:6060%:${OG_PORT}060%g; s%:26656%:${OG_PORT}656%g; s%:26660%:${OG_PORT}660%g" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/config.toml sed -i "s/address = \".*:3500\"/address = \"127\.0\.0\.1:${OG_PORT}500\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/app.toml sed -i "s/^rpc-dial-url *=.*/rpc-dial-url = \"http:\/\/localhost:${OG_PORT}551\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/app.toml ``` ### Step 11: Optimize Node Settings Disable indexer: ```bash sed -i -e "s/^indexer *=.*/indexer = \"null\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/config.toml ``` Configure pruning: ```bash sed -i -e "s/^pruning *=.*/pruning = \"custom\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/app.toml sed -i -e "s/^pruning-keep-recent *=.*/pruning-keep-recent = \"100\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/app.toml sed -i -e "s/^pruning-interval *=.*/pruning-interval = \"19\"/" $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/app.toml ``` Create symbolic link: ```bash ln -sf $HOME/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/config/client.toml $HOME/.0gchaind/config/client.toml ``` ### Step 12: Create Systemd Services #### Create 0ggeth Service ```bash sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/0ggeth.service > /dev/null < /dev/null < /dev/null <&1 | jq .SyncInfo # Check if node is catching up 0gchaind status 2>&1 | jq .SyncInfo.catching_up ``` ### Check Node Info ```bash # Get node ID 0gchaind tendermint show-node-id # Get validator info 0gchaind tendermint show-validator ``` ### Check Ports ```bash # List all listening ports ss -tulpn | grep LISTEN ``` ### Monitor System Resources ```bash # Check CPU and Memory usage htop # Check disk usage df -h # Check network connections netstat -tnp | grep ESTABLISHED ``` ## üÜò Troubleshooting ### Common Issues and Solutions #### 1. Node Not Starting - Check logs: `sudo journalctl -u 0gchaind -u 0ggeth -f` - Verify Go installation: `go version` - Check disk space: `df -h` - Ensure all ports are available #### 2. Sync Issues - Check peers: `curl -s localhost:${OG_PORT}657/net_info | jq .result.n_peers` - Verify genesis file is correct - Ensure proper network connectivity #### 3. Port Already in Use - Change `OG_PORT` variable to a different value - Re-run port configuration commands - Restart services #### 4. Permission Denied Errors - Ensure proper file permissions - Check user ownership of directories - Run commands with appropriate privileges ## üìö Resources - **Official Documentation**: [0G Labs GitHub](https://github.com/0glabs/0gchain-NG) - **Testnet Explorer**: Check official channels for explorer links - **Community Support**: Join official Discord/Telegram for support ## üîí Security Recommendations 1. **Firewall Configuration**: Only open necessary ports 2. **Regular Updates**: Keep your system and node software updated 3. **Backup Keys**: Always backup your validator keys securely 4. **Monitor Performance**: Regularly check node performance and logs 5. **Use SSH Keys**: Disable password authentication for SSH
**Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è for 0G Community** *Last Updated: 2025*

children.content:
# 0G Chain Validator Setup with Foundry
[![0G Chain](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=0G&message=Chain&color=blue&style=for-the-badge)](https://0g.ai) [![Foundry](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=Foundry&message=v1.2.3&color=green&style=for-the-badge)](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry) [![Ubuntu](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=Ubuntu&message=18.04%2B&color=orange&style=for-the-badge)](https://ubuntu.com) [![License](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=License&message=MIT&color=yellow&style=for-the-badge)](LICENSE) **üöÄ Complete guide to setup and manage 0G Chain validators using Foundry** [üìã Prerequisites](#-prerequisites) ‚Ä¢ [üöÄ Installation](#-installation) ‚Ä¢ [‚öôÔ∏è Setup](#Ô∏è-setup) ‚Ä¢ [üõ†Ô∏è Management](#Ô∏è-management) ‚Ä¢ [‚ö†Ô∏è Troubleshooting](#Ô∏è-troubleshooting) ---
## üìã Prerequisites ### Hardware Requirements | Component | Testnet | Mainnet | |-----------|---------|---------| | **RAM** | 64 GB | 64 GB | | **CPU** | 8 cores | 8 cores | | **Storage** | 4 TB NVME SSD | 1 TB NVME SSD | | **Network** | 100 Mbps | 100 Mbps | ### Software Requirements - ‚úÖ **Ubuntu 22.04+** or Debian-based Linux - ‚úÖ **0G Node** synced and running - ‚úÖ **32+ OG Tokens** for staking - ‚úÖ **Root/sudo access** - ‚úÖ **Stable internet connection** ### Network Information (Testnet) ```bash Network Name: 0G-Galileo-Testnet Chain ID: 16601 RPC URL: https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai Explorer: https://chainscan-galileo.0g.ai Faucet: https://faucet.0g.ai ``` --- ## üöÄ Installation ### 1. System Check ```bash # Check system compatibility echo "=== System Information ===" uname -a && arch && lsb_release -a # Install required packages sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y curl jq # Check if 0G node is synced curl -s http://localhost:26657/status | jq .result.sync_info.catching_up # USE YOUR OWN RPC PORT ,DEFAULT 26657 ,Should return: false (synced) ``` ### 2. Install Foundry ```bash # Install Foundry curl -L https://foundry.paradigm.xyz | bash source ~/.bashrc foundryup # Verify installation echo "=== Foundry Version Information ===" cast --version forge --version anvil --version ``` ### 3. Test 0G Chain Connection ```bash # Test connection to 0G testnet echo "=== 0G Chain Connection Test ===" # Check chain ID (should return 16601) cast chain-id --rpc-url https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai # Get current block number cast block-number --rpc-url https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai # Test staking contract read cast call 0xea224dBB52F57752044c0C86aD50930091F561B9 \ "validatorCount()(uint32)" \ --rpc-url https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai ``` --- ## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup ### 1. Environment Configuration ```bash # Set your node data path (adjust to your actual path) export HOME_DIR=/root/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home export GENESIS_PATH=$HOME_DIR/config/genesis.json export CHAIN_SPEC=devnet # 0G Testnet configuration export RPC_URL=https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai export STAKING_CONTRACT=0xea224dBB52F57752044c0C86aD50930091F561B9 # Stake amounts (different for EVM and Cosmos operations) export INITIAL_STAKE_EVM=32000000000000000000 # 32 OG in wei (for EVM/cast commands) export INITIAL_STAKE_COSMOS=32000000000 # 32 OG in Cosmos format (for 0gchaind commands) # Make persistent (add to ~/.bashrc) echo "export RPC_URL=https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai" >> ~/.bashrc echo "export STAKING_CONTRACT=0xea224dBB52F57752044c0C86aD50930091F561B9" >> ~/.bashrc echo "export INITIAL_STAKE_EVM=32000000000000000000" >> ~/.bashrc echo "export INITIAL_STAKE_COSMOS=32000000000" >> ~/.bashrc ``` ### 2. Verify Required Files ```bash # Check if required files exist ls -la $HOME_DIR/config/genesis.json || echo "‚ùå genesis.json not found!" ls -la $HOME_DIR/config/priv_validator_key.json || echo "‚ùå priv_validator_key.json not found!" # Check if 0gchaind binary is accessible which 0gchaind || echo "‚ùå 0gchaind not in PATH!" ``` ### 3. Generate Validator Keys ```bash # Generate validator public key echo "=== Generating Validator Keys ===" 0gchaind deposit validator-keys \ --home $HOME_DIR \ --chaincfg.chain-spec=$CHAIN_SPEC # Output example: # Eth/Beacon Pubkey (Compressed 48-byte Hex): # 0xaa0f99735a6436d6b7ed763c2eaa8452d753c5152a4fb1e4dc0bd7e33bcfc8cd4fac0e2d6cbab941f423c17728fecc56 ``` **‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT:** Copy the 48-byte pubkey from the output: ```bash # Replace with your actual pubkey export PUBKEY=0xaa0f99735a6436d6b7ed763c2eaa8452d753c5152a4fb1e4dc0bd7e33bcfc8cd4fac0e2d6cbab941f423c17728fecc56 ``` ### 4. Compute Validator Contract Address ```bash # Calculate validator contract address echo "=== Computing Validator Contract Address ===" VALIDATOR_CONTRACT=$(cast call $STAKING_CONTRACT \ "computeValidatorAddress(bytes)(address)" \ $PUBKEY \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL) echo "Validator Contract Address: $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT" export VALIDATOR_CONTRACT=$VALIDATOR_CONTRACT ``` ### 5. Generate Signature ```bash # Create validator signature (using Cosmos format) echo "=== Generating Validator Signature ===" 0gchaind deposit create-validator \ $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ $INITIAL_STAKE_COSMOS \ $GENESIS_PATH \ --home $HOME_DIR \ --chaincfg.chain-spec=$CHAIN_SPEC # Output example: # ‚úÖ Deposit message created successfully! # pubkey: 0xaa0f99735a6436d6b7ed763c2eaa8452d753c5152a4fb1e4dc0bd7e33bcfc8cd4fac0e2d6cbab941f423c17728fecc56 # signature: 0x8d9f2e7a6b5c4d3e8f1a2b3c4d5e6f7a8b9c0d1e2f3a4b5c6d7e8f9a0b1c2d3e... ``` **‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT:** Copy the signature from the output: ```bash # Replace with your actual signature export SIGNATURE=0x8d9f2e7a6b5c4d3e8f1a2b3c4d5e6f7a8b9c0d1e2f3a4b5c6d7e8f9a0b1c2d3e... ``` ### 6. Prepare Wallet ```bash # Set your private key (get from MetaMask) # ‚ö†Ô∏è SECURITY: Never share your private key! export PRIVATE_KEY=0x1234567890abcdef... # Replace with your actual private key # Check wallet balance (should have 32+ OG) export YOUR_WALLET_ADDRESS=0x... # Replace with your wallet address cast balance $YOUR_WALLET_ADDRESS --rpc-url $RPC_URL --ether ``` ### 7. Register Validator ```bash # Register validator with staking contract (using EVM format) echo "=== Registering Validator ===" cast send $STAKING_CONTRACT \ "createAndInitializeValidatorIfNecessary((string,string,string,string,string),uint32,uint96,bytes,bytes)" \ "('Your Validator Name','keybase-id','https://yourwebsite.com','security@youremail.com','Your validator description')" \ 50000 \ 1 \ $PUBKEY \ $SIGNATURE \ --value $INITIAL_STAKE_EVM \ --gas-limit 1000000 \ --gas-price 50000000000 \ --private-key $PRIVATE_KEY \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # You will receive a transaction hash # Example: 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef ``` #### Parameter Explanation: - `'Your Validator Name'`: Display name for your validator - `'keybase-id'`: Keybase identity (optional) - `'https://yourwebsite.com'`: Your website URL (optional) - `'security@youremail.com'`: Contact email - `'Your validator description'`: Brief description - `50000`: 5% commission rate (50000/1000000) - `1`: 1 gwei withdrawal fee --- ## üîç Verification ### 1. Check Transaction Status ```bash # Check transaction on explorer echo "Check your transaction at: https://chainscan-galileo.0g.ai" # Verify transaction status (replace with your actual tx hash) cast tx 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` ### 2. Verify Validator Registration ```bash # Check if validator is registered echo "=== Validator Registration Check ===" # Get validator contract address cast call $STAKING_CONTRACT \ "getValidator(bytes)(address)" \ $PUBKEY \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Check validator balance (should show 32000000000000000000) cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "tokens()(uint256)" \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Check commission rate (should show 50000) cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "commissionRate()(uint32)" \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Check delegator shares cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "delegatorShares()(uint256)" \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` ### 3. Monitor Node Logs ```bash # Monitor validator activation in node logs tail -f $HOME_DIR/../log/0gchaind.log | grep -i validator # Check consensus participation curl -s http://localhost:26657/validators | jq '.result.validators[] | select(.pub_key.value != null)' ``` --- ## üõ†Ô∏è Management ### Withdraw Commission ```bash # Withdraw earned commission (only validator operator can do this) cast send $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "withdrawCommission(address)" \ $YOUR_WALLET_ADDRESS \ --gas-limit 1000000 \ --gas-price 50000000000 \ --private-key $PRIVATE_KEY \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` ### Check Delegation Information ```bash # View total delegator shares cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "delegatorShares()(uint256)" \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Check specific delegator's shares cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "getDelegation(address)(address,uint256)" \ $DELEGATOR_ADDRESS \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Calculate estimated token value for shares # Formula: (shares * totalTokens) / totalShares ``` ### Delegate Additional Tokens ```bash # Add more stake to your validator cast send $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "delegate(address)" \ $YOUR_WALLET_ADDRESS \ --value 1000000000000000000 \ --gas-limit 1000000 \ --gas-price 50000000000 \ --private-key $PRIVATE_KEY \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` ### Undelegate (Advanced) ```bash # Undelegate shares (requires withdrawal fee) cast send $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ "undelegate(address,uint256)" \ $WITHDRAWAL_ADDRESS \ $SHARES_AMOUNT \ --value 1000000000000000000 \ --private-key $PRIVATE_KEY \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` ### Network Statistics ```bash # Total validator count cast call $STAKING_CONTRACT \ "validatorCount()(uint32)" \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Maximum validator count cast call $STAKING_CONTRACT \ "maxValidatorCount()(uint32)" \ --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Current gas price cast gas-price --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` --- ## ‚ö†Ô∏è Troubleshooting ### Common Errors #### 1. "insufficient funds" ```bash # Check wallet balance cast balance $YOUR_WALLET_ADDRESS --rpc-url $RPC_URL --ether # Need at least 32.1 OG (extra for gas) # Get test tokens from faucet echo "Get tokens from: https://faucet.0g.ai" ``` #### 2. "DelegationBelowMinimum" ```bash # Check stake amount for EVM operations echo $INITIAL_STAKE_EVM # Must be exactly 32000000000000000000 (32 OG in wei) # Check stake amount for Cosmos operations echo $INITIAL_STAKE_COSMOS # Must be exactly 32000000000 (32 OG in Cosmos format) ``` #### 3. "signature mismatch" ```bash # Regenerate signature (using Cosmos format) 0gchaind deposit create-validator \ $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT \ $INITIAL_STAKE_COSMOS \ $GENESIS_PATH \ --home $HOME_DIR \ --chaincfg.chain-spec=$CHAIN_SPEC ``` #### 4. "command not found: 0gchaind" ```bash # Check if 0gchaind is in PATH which 0gchaind # Add to PATH if needed export PATH=$PATH:/path/to/0gchaind/bin echo 'export PATH=$PATH:/path/to/0gchaind/bin' >> ~/.bashrc ``` #### 5. "invalid opcode" ```bash # Check if using correct EVM version # Ensure contracts are compiled with --evm-version cancun ``` ### Debug Commands ```bash # Check node sync status curl -s http://localhost:26657/status | jq .result.sync_info # Check network connection curl -s https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai >/dev/null && echo "‚úÖ RPC accessible" || echo "‚ùå Connection issue" # View latest block cast block latest --rpc-url $RPC_URL # Check transaction pool cast tx-pool --rpc-url $RPC_URL ``` ### Health Check Script ```bash #!/bin/bash echo "=== 0G Validator Health Check ===" echo "1. Node sync status:" curl -s http://localhost:26657/status | jq -r .result.sync_info.catching_up echo "2. Validator contract address:" cast call $STAKING_CONTRACT "getValidator(bytes)(address)" $PUBKEY --rpc-url $RPC_URL echo "3. Validator balance:" cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT "tokens()(uint256)" --rpc-url $RPC_URL echo "4. Commission rate:" cast call $VALIDATOR_CONTRACT "commissionRate()(uint32)" --rpc-url $RPC_URL echo "5. Total network validators:" cast call $STAKING_CONTRACT "validatorCount()(uint32)" --rpc-url $RPC_URL echo "6. Wallet balance:" cast balance $YOUR_WALLET_ADDRESS --rpc-url $RPC_URL --ether echo "7. Stake amounts:" echo " EVM format: $INITIAL_STAKE_EVM" echo " Cosmos format: $INITIAL_STAKE_COSMOS" echo "=== Health check complete ===" ``` --- ## ‚úÖ Success Criteria Your validator setup is successful if: - ‚úÖ **Transaction confirmed** - Shows SUCCESS status on explorer - ‚úÖ **getValidator()** returns your validator contract address - ‚úÖ **tokens()** returns 32000000000000000000 (32 OG in wei) - ‚úÖ **Node logs** show validator activation messages - ‚úÖ **Consensus participation** - Validator appears in validator set --- ## üìö Resources ### Official Links - **Documentation**: https://docs.0g.ai - **GitHub**: https://github.com/0glabs - **Block Explorer**: https://chainscan-galileo.0g.ai - **Faucet**: https://faucet.0g.ai ### Contract Addresses - **Staking Contract**: `0xea224dBB52F57752044c0C86aD50930091F561B9` ### RPC Endpoints - **Primary**: https://evmrpc-testnet.0g.ai - **QuickNode**: Custom endpoint available - **ThirdWeb**: Custom endpoint available ### Support - **Discord**: [0G Labs Community](https://discord.gg/0glabs) - **Telegram**: Official 0G Channel - **GitHub Issues**: For technical problems --- ## üìÑ License This guide is released under the MIT License. See [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details. ---
**üéâ Congratulations! You are now running a 0G Chain validator! üéâ** *If you found this guide helpful, please ‚≠ê star this repository!*

# 0gchain v2.0.3 Update

```javascript
CURRENT_PATH=$(which 0gchaind)
systemctl stop 0gchaind geth
wget https://github.com/0glabs/0gchain-NG/releases/download/v2.0.3/galileo-v2.0.3.tar.gz
tar -xzf galileo-v2.0.3.tar.gz
cp galileo-v2.0.3/bin/0gchaind $CURRENT_PATH
chmod +x $CURRENT_PATH
systemctl start geth
sleep 5
systemctl start 0gchaind
journalctl -u 0gchaind -f

```

children.content:
# 0G Storage Node Installation Guide

A comprehensive guide for installing and managing 0G Storage Node on Ubuntu/Debian systems.



## Prerequisites

### System Requirements
- **OS**: Ubuntu 20.04+ or Debian 11+
- **CPU**: 4+ cores recommended
- **RAM**: 8GB+ recommended
- **Storage**: 100GB+ SSD
- **Network**: Stable internet connection

## Installation

### Step 1: Install Dependencies

Update your system and install required packages:

```bash
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install clang cmake build-essential openssl pkg-config libssl-dev jq git bc curl wget -y
```

### Step 2: Install Go

Install Go programming language (version 1.22.0):

```bash
cd $HOME
ver="1.22.0"
wget "https://golang.org/dl/go$ver.linux-amd64.tar.gz"
sudo rm -rf /usr/local/go
sudo tar -C /usr/local -xzf "go$ver.linux-amd64.tar.gz"
rm "go$ver.linux-amd64.tar.gz"
echo "export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin:$HOME/go/bin" >> ~/.bash_profile
source ~/.bash_profile
go version
```

### Step 3: Install Rust

Install Rust programming language:

```bash
curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh -s -- -y
source "$HOME/.cargo/env"
rustc --version
```

### Step 4: Clone and Build 0G Storage Node

Download the source code and build the node:

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone -b v1.1.0 https://github.com/0glabs/0g-storage-node.git

# Navigate to the directory
cd $HOME/0g-storage-node

# Ensure we're on the correct version
git stash
git fetch --all --tags
git checkout v1.1.0
git submodule update --init

# Build the project
cargo build --release
```

## Configuration

### Step 1: Download Configuration File

Remove the default config and download the optimized configuration:

```bash
rm -rf $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml
curl -o $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml https://vault.astrostake.xyz/testnet/0g-labs/config-v3.toml
```

### Step 2: Configure Miner Key

Edit the configuration file to add your private key:

```bash
nano $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml
```

Find the `miner_key` line and replace with your private key (without 0x prefix):

```toml
# Miner key is used to sign blockchain transaction for incentive.
# The value should be a hex string of length 64 without 0x prefix.
#
# Note, the corresponding address should have enough tokens to pay
# transaction gas fee.
miner_key = "YOUR_PRIVATE_KEY_HERE"
```

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: 
> - Your private key should be 64 characters long (without 0x prefix)
> - The corresponding wallet address must have sufficient tokens for gas fees
> - Never share your private key with anyone

## Service Management

### Create Systemd Service

Create a systemd service for automatic startup and management:

```bash
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/zgs.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=0G Storage Node
After=network.target

[Service]
User=$USER
WorkingDirectory=$HOME/0g-storage-node/run
ExecStart=$HOME/0g-storage-node/target/release/zgs_node --config $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=10
LimitNOFILE=65535

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF
```

### Start the Service

Enable and start the 0G Storage Node service:

```bash
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable zgs
sudo systemctl start zgs
```

### Check Service Status

```bash
sudo systemctl status zgs
```

## Security Setup

Configure firewall to allow necessary ports:

```bash
# Allow P2P communication port
sudo ufw allow 1234/tcp comment '0G Storage P2P Port'
sudo ufw allow 1234/udp comment '0G Storage P2P Port'

# Allow RPC port (if needed for external access)
sudo ufw allow 5678/tcp comment '0G Storage RPC Port'

# Enable firewall
sudo ufw enable
```

## Monitoring Tools

### Block Checker Script

Save this script to monitor your node's synchronization status:

```bash
# Create the monitoring script
cat > $HOME/check_storage_blocks.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash

echo ""
echo "üõ∞Ô∏è  0G Storage Block Checker"
echo "==============================="
echo ""

# Detect RPC from Systemd Service
SYSTEMD_SERVICE="/etc/systemd/system/zgs.service"
if [[ -f "$SYSTEMD_SERVICE" ]]; then
    RPC_URL=$(grep -oP '(?<=--rpc\s)[^ ]+|(?<=--blockchain_rpc_endpoint\s)[^ ]+' "$SYSTEMD_SERVICE" | head -n 1)
fi

# If RPC from systemd is not found, check from config.toml
if [[ -z "$RPC_URL" ]]; then
    RPC_URL=$(grep 'blockchain_rpc_endpoint' $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml | cut -d '"' -f2)
fi

# If there is still no RPC URL, use the default
if [[ -z "$RPC_URL" ]]; then
    RPC_URL="https://0g-testnet-rpc.astrostake.xyz"
    echo -e "‚ùå RPC URL not detected in systemd service or config.toml."
    echo -e "üåê Using default RPC: \033[1;34m$RPC_URL\033[0m"
fi

# Display RPC used
echo -e "üîó RPC: \033[1;34m$RPC_URL\033[0m"
echo -e ""

# Check node version
cd $HOME/0g-storage-node
VERSION=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null)
if [[ -n "$VERSION" ]]; then
    echo -e "üß© Storage Node Version: \e[1;32m$VERSION\e[0m"
else
    echo -e "üß© Storage Node Version: \e[31mUnknown\e[0m"
fi

echo -e ""

prev_block=0
prev_time=0

while true; do 
    # Fetch local node status
    LOCAL_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST http://127.0.0.1:5678 -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"zgs_getStatus","params":[],"id":1}')
    logSyncHeight=$(echo "$LOCAL_RESPONSE" | jq '.result.logSyncHeight' 2>/dev/null)
    connectedPeers=$(echo "$LOCAL_RESPONSE" | jq '.result.connectedPeers' 2>/dev/null)

    # Fetch network block number
    NETWORK_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -m 5 -X POST "$RPC_URL" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_blockNumber","params":[],"id":1}')
    latestBlockHex=$(echo "$NETWORK_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.result' 2>/dev/null)

    # Validate block status
    if [[ "$logSyncHeight" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
        local_status="$logSyncHeight"
    else
        local_status="N/A"
    fi

    [[ "$connectedPeers" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || connectedPeers=0

    if [[ "$NETWORK_RESPONSE" == *"rate limit"* || "$NETWORK_RESPONSE" == *"Too Many Requests"* ]]; then
        network_status="N/A (RPC Rate Limited)"
    elif [[ -z "$NETWORK_RESPONSE" || "$NETWORK_RESPONSE" == "null" ]]; then
        network_status="N/A (RPC Timeout)"
    elif [[ "$latestBlockHex" =~ ^0x[0-9a-fA-F]+$ ]]; then
        latestBlock=$((16#${latestBlockHex:2}))
        network_status="$latestBlock"
    else
        network_status="N/A (Invalid RPC Response)"
    fi

    # Calculate BPS and ETA
    extra_info=""
    if [[ "$logSyncHeight" =~ ^[0-9]+$ && "$latestBlock" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
        block_diff=$((latestBlock - logSyncHeight))
        current_time=$(date +%s)

        # Only show speed & ETA if block difference is 10 or more
        if [ "$block_diff" -ge 10 ]; then
            if [[ "$prev_block" =~ ^[0-9]+$ && "$prev_time" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]]; then
                delta_block=$((logSyncHeight - prev_block))
                delta_time=$((current_time - prev_time))

                if (( delta_time > 0 && delta_block >= 0 )); then
                    bps=$(echo "scale=2; $delta_block / $delta_time" | bc)
                    if (( $(echo "$bps > 0" | bc -l) )); then
                        eta_sec=$(echo "scale=0; $block_diff / $bps" | bc)
                        if (( eta_sec < 60 )); then
                            eta_display="$eta_sec sec"
                        elif (( eta_sec < 3600 )); then
                            eta_display="$((eta_sec / 60)) min"
                        elif (( eta_sec < 86400 )); then
                            eta_display="$((eta_sec / 3600)) hr"
                        else
                            eta_display="$((eta_sec / 86400)) day(s)"
                        fi
                        extra_info="| Speed: ${bps} blocks/s | ETA: ${eta_display}"
                    else
                        extra_info="| Speed: 0 blocks/s | ETA: ‚àû"
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        fi

        prev_block=$logSyncHeight
        prev_time=$current_time

        # Set color based on block difference
        if [ "$block_diff" -le 5 ]; then
            diff_color="\\033[32m" # Green
        elif [ "$block_diff" -le 20 ]; then
            diff_color="\\033[33m" # Yellow
        else
            diff_color="\\033[31m" # Red
        fi

        block_status="(\033[0m${diff_color}Behind $block_diff\033[0m)"
    else
        block_status=""
    fi

    # Display Status
    echo -e "Local Block: \033[32m$local_status\033[0m / Network Block: \033[33m$network_status\033[0m $block_status | Peers: \033[34m$connectedPeers\033[0m $extra_info"
    sleep 5
done
EOF

# Make the script executable
chmod +x $HOME/check_storage_blocks.sh
```

Run the block checker:

```bash
$HOME/check_storage_blocks.sh
```

### RPC Updater Script

Script to easily change RPC endpoints:

```bash
# Create RPC updater script
cat > $HOME/change_storage_rpc.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash

CONFIG_FILE="$HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml"

echo "==================================="
echo "    Storage RPC Updater Script     "
echo "==================================="
echo ""

# Check if config file exists
if [[ ! -f "$CONFIG_FILE" ]]; then
    echo "‚ùå Error: Config file not found at $CONFIG_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

# Get current RPC from config.toml
CURRENT_RPC=$(grep -oP '(?<=^blockchain_rpc_endpoint = ")[^"]+' "$CONFIG_FILE")

echo "üîπ Current RPC: $CURRENT_RPC"
echo ""

# Get new RPC input from user
read -p "Enter the new RPC URL: " NEW_RPC

# Check if user provided input
if [[ -z "$NEW_RPC" ]]; then
    echo "‚ùå No RPC URL provided. Exiting..."
    exit 1
fi

# Validate RPC format
if ! [[ "$NEW_RPC" =~ ^https?:// ]]; then
    echo "‚ùå Invalid RPC URL format. Must start with http:// or https://"
    exit 1
fi

# Check if new RPC is same as current
if [[ "$NEW_RPC" == "$CURRENT_RPC" ]]; then
    echo "‚ö†Ô∏è New RPC is the same as the current one. No changes made."
    exit 0
fi

# Update configuration
sed -i "s|^blockchain_rpc_endpoint = .*|blockchain_rpc_endpoint = \"$NEW_RPC\"|" "$CONFIG_FILE"

# Restart zgs service
echo ""
echo "Restarting zgs service..."
sudo systemctl restart zgs

# Confirm changes
echo "‚úÖ RPC updated to: $NEW_RPC"
echo "==============================="
EOF

# Make the script executable
chmod +x $HOME/change_storage_rpc.sh
```

Run the RPC updater:

```bash
$HOME/change_storage_rpc.sh
```

## Useful Commands

### Check Service Status
```bash
sudo systemctl status zgs
```

### View Real-time Logs
```bash
sudo journalctl -u zgs -f
```

### View Storage Node Logs
```bash
tail -f ~/0g-storage-node/run/log/zgs.log.$(TZ=UTC date +%Y-%m-%d)
```

### Restart Service
```bash
sudo systemctl restart zgs
```

### Stop Service
```bash
sudo systemctl stop zgs
```

### Check Node Version
```bash
cd $HOME/0g-storage-node && git describe --tags --abbrev=0
```

### Check Local Node Status
```bash
curl -s -X POST http://127.0.0.1:5678 -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"zgs_getStatus","params":[],"id":1}' | jq
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. Node Not Syncing
- Check if the RPC endpoint is working
- Verify your miner key is correct
- Check firewall settings
- Ensure sufficient disk space

#### 2. Service Won't Start
```bash
# Check service status
sudo systemctl status zgs

# View detailed logs
sudo journalctl -u zgs -n 50

# Check config file syntax
cat $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/config.toml
```

#### 3. Connection Issues
```bash
# Test RPC connectivity
curl -X POST YOUR_RPC_URL -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_blockNumber","params":[],"id":1}'

# Check firewall
sudo ufw status

# Check port binding
sudo netstat -tlnp | grep :5678
```

#### 4. Build Errors
```bash
# Clean and rebuild
cd $HOME/0g-storage-node
cargo clean
cargo build --release
```

### Reset Node Data

If you need to reset your node and start fresh:

```bash
# Stop the service
sudo systemctl stop zgs

# Remove node data (keeps config)
rm -rf $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/db
rm -rf $HOME/0g-storage-node/run/log

# Start the service
sudo systemctl start zgs
```

### Complete Removal

To completely remove the node:

```bash
# Stop and disable service
sudo systemctl stop zgs
sudo systemctl disable zgs

# Remove service file
sudo rm /etc/systemd/system/zgs.service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload

# Remove node directory
rm -rf $HOME/0g-storage-node

# Remove scripts
rm -f $HOME/check_storage_blocks.sh
rm -f $HOME/change_storage_rpc.sh
```

## Support

- **Official Documentation**: [0G Labs Documentation](https://docs.0g.ai/)
- **Discord**: [0G Labs Discord](https://discord.gg/0glabs)
- **GitHub**: [0G Storage Node Repository](https://github.com/0glabs/0g-storage-node)

---

**Note**: This guide is for testnet purposes. Always ensure you understand the risks involved in running blockchain nodes and never share your private keys.

- **üì¶ Size**: ~70MB Consensus + ~131GB Execution
- **üåê Network**: 0G Testnet

## üìã Prerequisites

Install required tools:

```bash
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt update
```

## üìä Check Latest Snapshot

## üöÄ Download & Install Snapshots

### Step 1: Prepare Environment

```bash
# Stop 0G services
sudo systemctl stop 0gchaind 0ggeth

# Backup validator state (IMPORTANT!)
mkdir -p /tmp/0g-backup
cp ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/data/priv_validator_state.json /tmp/0g-backup/

# Clear old data (but keep structure)
rm -rf ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/data/*
rm -rf ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/geth-home/geth/chaindata
mkdir -p ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/data
mkdir -p ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/geth-home/geth
```

### Step 2: Download Snapshots

```bash
# Get latest snapshot URLs
API_DATA=$(curl -s https://snaps.coinsspor.com/api/0g/)
CONSENSUS_URL="https://snaps.coinsspor.com$(echo "$API_DATA" | jq -r '.snapshots[] | select(.type=="consensus") | .url')"
EXECUTION_URL="https://snaps.coinsspor.com$(echo "$API_DATA" | jq -r '.snapshots[] | select(.type=="execution") | .url')"

echo "Downloading from:"
echo "Consensus: $CONSENSUS_URL"
echo "Execution: $EXECUTION_URL"

# Download with aria2c (ultra-fast multi-connection)
mkdir -p /tmp/0g-snapshots
cd /tmp/0g-snapshots

# Optimized aria2c settings for maximum speed
ARIA2C_OPTS=(
    --max-connection-per-server=12
    --split=12
    --min-split-size=10M
    --max-concurrent-downloads=2
    --disk-cache=64M
    --file-allocation=falloc
    --continue=true
    --max-tries=5
    --retry-wait=2
    --timeout=120
    --user-agent="Coinsspor-0G-Client/1.0"
)

# Download consensus (~70MB) - Super fast
echo "üì• Downloading 0G consensus snapshot..."
aria2c "${ARIA2C_OPTS[@]}" "$CONSENSUS_URL"

# Download execution (~131GB) - Ultra fast with 12 connections  
echo "üì• Downloading 0G execution snapshot..."
aria2c "${ARIA2C_OPTS[@]}" "$EXECUTION_URL"
```

### Step 3: Extract Snapshots

```bash
# Extract consensus to 0gchaind data directory
echo "üìÇ Extracting 0G consensus snapshot..."
CONSENSUS_FILE=$(basename "$CONSENSUS_URL")
lz4 -dc "$CONSENSUS_FILE" | tar -xf - -C ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/data/

# Extract execution to 0ggeth data directory
echo "üìÇ Extracting 0G execution snapshot..."
EXECUTION_FILE=$(basename "$EXECUTION_URL")
lz4 -dc "$EXECUTION_FILE" | tar -xf - -C ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/geth-home/
```

### Step 4: Restore & Start

```bash
# Restore validator state
cp /tmp/0g-backup/priv_validator_state.json ~/.0gchaind/0g-home/0gchaind-home/data/

# Start 0G services
sudo systemctl start 0ggeth
sleep 10
sudo systemctl start 0gchaind

# Cleanup temporary files and downloaded snapshots
echo "üßπ Cleaning up temporary files..."
rm -rf /tmp/0g-snapshots /tmp/0g-backup

# Remove downloaded snapshot files to save disk space
echo "üóëÔ∏è Removing downloaded snapshot files to save disk space..."
cd /tmp
rm -f coinsspor-0g-*.tar.lz4
echo "‚úÖ Cleanup completed!"
```

## üìä Verify Installation

```bash
# Check 0G services
sudo systemctl status 0gchaind 0ggeth

# Monitor 0G sync
sudo journalctl -u 0gchaind -f

# Check 0G sync status
0gchaind status --node tcp://localhost:47657 | jq '.SyncInfo'

# Check if node is catching up
curl -s localhost:47657/status | jq '.result.sync_info.catching_up'
```

- ‚úÖ **Validator Safe**: Automatic state backup/restore
- ‚úÖ **Rollback Ready**: Original data preserved until completion
- ‚úÖ **SSL Secured**: HTTPS downloads only
- ‚úÖ **Integrity Check**: LZ4 built-in verification
